forecast-period.text: For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-360-223* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 number cost around 27.5c inc. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecast or Local Waters Forecast for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for these coastal zones.

area.description: Perth Coast: Two Rocks to Dawesville

forecast-period.text: Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.

A ridge of high pressure lies over the southeastern part of the State as a surface trough deepens over the Gascoyne and northern parts of the South West Land Division. During tonight and Sunday the surface trough will deepen further near the west coast, before moving eastwards on Monday.
Winds: Southerly 15 to 20 knots turning southeasterly 10 to 15 knots in the late evening. Seas: Around 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly around 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy.

Winds: East to southeasterly about 10 knots tending southerly 15 to 20 knots in the middle of the day then tending southeasterly 10 to 15 knots in the late evening. Seas: Below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres around midday. Swell: Southwesterly 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to around 1 metre during the morning. Weather: Mostly sunny.

Winds: East to northeasterly about 10 knots tending west to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots in the middle of the day then turning southerly 15 to 25 knots in the early afternoon. Seas: Below 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 2 metres around midday. Swell: Southwesterly around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Weather: Mostly sunny.

Winds: South to southeasterly 15 to 25 knots tending south to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots during the day then turning southeasterly during the afternoon. Seas: 1.5 to 2.5 metres. Swell: Southwesterly 1 to 1.5 metres, increasing to 1 to 2 metres during the morning. Weather: Partly cloudy.
Winds: Southeasterly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres. Swell: Southwesterly 1 to 1.5 metres. Weather: Partly cloudy.
